column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I suddenly started having repeated yeast infections.  After taking the medication for the yeast infection I would immediately develope BV.  I started using Rephresh to restore the pH balance.  It works wonderful!  I have been using it for about a month now and no more infections or odor.  And it also helped with the discomfort after sex.  My only side effect was a heavy discharge that initially scared me until I read about it in the FAQs.  It appears to be subsiding the more I use the product.  Also, I read one woman's post about the cost.  I by it at Walmart or CVS and it is never more than $13.  I also use lots of coupons they are available inside the box and on the internet.

column9: The applicator was very hard to use. Hard to get the product out of the plunger. I also bled for 3 weeks after using this stuff. And I only used one application. I also take Seasonique, so it may have totally thrown off my pH levels. Im not sure what happened.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: My gynecologist recommended this for a pH imbalance after intercourse. It is wonderful. It eliminates all of the odor a pH imbalance creates. Unfortunately, the product is ridiculously expensive. The company no longer makes the cost-friendly tube, and now they only sell it in packs of four single use inserts for about $20 for a 12-day supply. While I think this product is wonderful, the cost is a big issue. Maybe someday there will be a generic or the manufacturer may realize people can't pay over $600 for a year's supply of single use inserts. Plus think of the environmental impact of all that tossed plastic.
